alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 12 at 2:53AM CDT until June 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 3 PM this afternoon to 8 PM CDT this evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham and Deaf Smith. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...3 to 4. * Timing...3 PM to 8 PM CDT.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
